column1: 10E7CF4A-19B3-4053-BE62-5E2EFFF49C6A#appfire#105C212D-23E8-464A-9936-BD4AD3F1BCA4#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#45AE30F6-5350-4E8A-AFBC-36DCDA1F47FE#appfire#105C212D-23E8-464A-9936-BD4AD3F1BCA4#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#B664D339-7AFA-438E-B1BC-EB9A7B27648B#appfire#105C212D-23E8-464A-9936-BD4AD3F1BCA4#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-02-29 15:19:16.0#appfire#1
